what: Your Year in {ggplot2}! Plus Tools For Exploring Your Dataviz With {ggplot2}!
title: Your Year in {ggplot2}! Plus Tools For Exploring Your Dataviz With {ggplot2}!
text: year {ggplot2}! Check example ggplot2wrapped report 2025! package attempts give Spotify Wrapped experience looking use incredible {gglot2} package visualising data! Within package find 3 kinds things: ggplot_wrapped_2025() building personalised interactive report year {ggplot2} Functions extracting geom usage across whole code base. Individual visualisation functions used within interactive report exploring geom usage runs fully local doesn’t use LLMs. fact, LLM free also built designed hand. Slop free .

title: Your Year in {ggplot2}! Plus Tools For Exploring Your Dataviz With {ggplot2}!
text: package currently available GitHub dependencies aware . need install remotes::install_github("charliejhadley/GPCDStools") work: doesn’t may issues dependency {highcharter} depends {igraph}. using R homebrew might reason {igraph} doesn’t like built source.

title: Your Year in {ggplot2}! Plus Tools For Exploring Your Dataviz With {ggplot2}!
text: First need collect info code files. Modify first argument look locations ’re interested looking . example usage data data_example_geom_usage object prefer Great! Now package thrown together week makes assumptions report assumes ’re looking 2025 data - let’s filter data. Now clever function add_geom_usage_to_files() extracts geom usage, lots files might take minutes. geoms look ? output function contains potentially sensitive information!! actual geom calls function_call argument might say geom_point(size = state_secrets). build {ggplot2wrapped} nice report drop argument - sensitive information included report. Neat! ’re now ready create report, ’ll saved project/working directory name Charlie's ggplot2wrapped.html example usage data data_example_geom_usage object prefer Enjoy reading please consider sharing report (Charlotte Hadley) ’d love see !
code: library("ggplot2wrapped") code_files <- get_code_file_info(c("~/Github/", "~/coding/r-projects-scrapbook/"), file_type = c(".qmd", ".R", ".Rmd"))  code_files #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   file_path          modified_time       created_time        access_time         #>   <chr>              <dttm>              <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 /Users/charliejha… 2022-04-20 20:10:12 2022-04-20 20:10:12 2025-11-21 14:28:18 #> 2 /Users/charliejha… 2022-04-20 20:10:14 2022-04-20 20:10:14 2025-11-21 14:06:55 library("tidyverse") target_year <- 2025 code_files_from_target_year <- code_files |>   filter(year(modified_time) == target_year) data_geoms_usage_target_year <- code_files_from_target_year |>    add_geom_usage_to_files() #> # A tibble: 2 × 12 #>   file_path               file_extension modified_time       created_time        #>   <chr>                   <chr>          <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 /Users/charliejhadley/… R              2021-08-31 17:53:54 2022-04-07 19:50:42 #> 2 /Users/charliejhadley/… R              2021-08-31 17:53:54 2022-04-07 19:50:42 #> # ℹ 8 more variables: access_time <dttm>, geom_name <chr>, has_aes <lgl>, #> #   function_call <list>, length_of_call <dbl>, n_args_in_call <dbl>, #> #   n_times_used <int>, package_name <chr> data_geoms_usage_target_year %>%    ggplot_wrapped_2025(data_geoms, report_year = target_year, exported_report_name = "Charlie's ggplot2wrapped.html")

what: Which geoms do we look at?
title: Your Year in {ggplot2}! Plus Tools For Exploring Your Dataviz With {ggplot2}!
text: Ah. package uses {astgrepr} work Abstract Syntax Trees code files. need able differentiate : therefore explicitly white list geoms included analysis. Earlier defaut argument used didn’t mention: data_geoms dataset includes geoms {ggplot2}, {ggrepel} {ggtext}. ’re welcome provide large white list, note custom geom names arguments might sensitive.
code: # We want ggplot() +   geom_point()  # We don't want g_title <- "I love geom_point"  # We don't want geom_state_secret_custom <- function(){    } data_geoms_usage_target_year <- code_files_from_target_year |>    add_geom_usage_to_files(data_geoms = ggplot2wrapped::data_geoms)

title: Your Year in {ggplot2}! Plus Tools For Exploring Your Dataviz With {ggplot2}!
text: gave week write package, report visualisations within. currently 10 visualisations available.  Almost available functions within package can used . Note ’ll increasing customisation functions release 2025 wrapped report!
